content.content: Already 27,784 Bitcoins were purchased to back Terra’s Ust stablecoin. Capital earmarked to buy Bitcoin wrapped up as a reserve (1.318B / +10B).  0a28a064-cc77-4cad-b7d6-4d09470dc61d1080×694 45.9 KB  Terra plans to buy $10 billion in Bitcoin, and that over the long term the value of that reserve will grow to back both new Ust issuances and existing Ust. Ust will now be backed by Luna and Bitcoin.  4ff5eb11-e999-420a-8597-dfc3627342801080×404 39.6 KB  The Luna Foundation Guard confirmed that they have raised $2.2 billion to invest in Bitcoin as a reserve for Ust. Terra will not sell Luna to build its reserves. Bitcoin reserves will be used to back Ust’s near-term repayments and for a decentralized currency reserve. “According to a recent conversation with Terra community members, there is approximately USD 100 million to $200 million of new demand for Ust per day.”  befdb9db-29ad-477d-b6e9-7e0779a2ea2f960×1280 93.5 KB  Kwon somewhat defiantly outlined that the project will continue to “grow its reserves until it becomes mathematically impossible for idiots to claim de-peg risk for Ust”. The competition is starting to become fiercely competitive, Maker needs to pick up the pace of the work being done with RWA and RWF, work with greater diligence and performance than before, more aggressive growth decisions should be considered as is https://forum.makerdao.com/t/aggressive-growth-strategy/13958?u, otherwise current and future competition that is inspired by current projects and mechanisms with improvements on top of that, are going to make existence difficult for Maker. It is starting to be interesting the option of adding Ust as another collateral for Dai, because it would be like implementing in a way indirectly a combination of Bitcoin with Luna as collateral, we still have to see how it continues to develop, but it is smart to have it in our sights as the next collateral.

Friend with all due respect it seems to me that you did not read the whole post, and if you read the whole post then it seems to me that you are not informed about what is happening in these last days with Ust, although I agree with your opinion of MIM, it is the highest risk stablecoin that exists according to my opinion.

I don’t trust UST and their narrative, I respect their growth and their way of creating “adoption”, but at what cost, they are already paying the price with these desperate purchases. In general I prefer that we don’t get involved directly or indirectly with them.
Rather maybe $DAI as collateral for $UST

twitter.com    Do Kwon 🌕 @stablekwon  By my hand $DAI will die.   4:54 AM - 23 Mar 2022           5.1K                470            I don’t think gabriel uses twitter much. Of course he mentions UST when they openly declare war on us.

why not make money of the ust rise. we got reserve on mkr. buy luna stake it and used the rewards as collateral to mint more dai.  This way we increase dai supply. and make it easier for user to used dai.
We don’t even buy ETH “stake it and used the rewards as collateral to mint more dai.” Buying Luna to do this way is too risky
Do you understand governance processes?
I mean granted, the Maker community did talk negative about UST and Terra ecosystem for a while so I wouldn’t take it too personal
thats also good  . The barrier for mkr right now is the over collateral method of minting dai. If there was an easier way i think dai could be back on top.

We would be missing out on a market opportunity because we are biased by the offensive comments of Terra’s community and CEO towards Dai, there is no need to involve emotions and feelings in this kind of things. It is not wise for Terra’s group to express itself in this way against Dai, but it is even less wise if we let it affect our financial decisions.

As of today, there is nothing positive from UST towards DAI. Nothing we can do for long term business. DAI focuses on long term business, no opportunities, that’s something I’ve noticed here.  image1920×897 85 KB  The network only works because of Anchor, the day Anchor stops giving those returns, the UST Ponzi falls down  They were given 700 million in liquidity, every day it eats up about 6 million UST’s of the same… all bad

True, I agree, it is unsustainable anchor APY, but only in case they did nothing about it, for that reason Terra is backing Ust with Bitcoin, the probability of bank run like “Iron finance” is slowly decreasing, other things that add up to anchor like “Dynamic Earn rate” which already ran on the 24th of this month, they included AVAX as collateral on the 20th of this month, already 25% of Ust are issued by bETH, and they plan to add even more collateral…
I like it, also Dai as a guarantee for MIM ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
An easier way to mint Dai, what do you mean, you mean the L1 Eth commissions that hinder minting for retailers with little capital?
These desperate purchases could make Terra twice as many Bitcoins as MicroStrategy, even if Bitcoins were purchased at ATH, that would be more units than MicroStrategy has.
It will not change that they will need more reserves to back up those UST. I do not trust them

I understand you, those reserves will grow in value over time and will back new issues, plus the new collaterals added will grow in number and value, like the one I mentioned “AVAX”, we just have to give it a chance to mature, I do not blindly trust this project but I do not ignore it and disqualify it either
Piratical:  Blow a man down, boys!   I’ll skip that. Thanks.

Terra design might be flawed. But in the past year, they’ve partnered with Chai, created Anchor Protocol and Mirror Protocol, then DEXs, and now marketing spend with BTC maxis. It’s all about execution and adoption by top-notch founder building a fast growing Fintech startup. At Maker, in the past year, we’ve disabled Makerburn, spent most of our protocol profits on various Core Units including “Strategic Happiness” and ESG. Our Maker design might be solid, but the governance reeks of decay and complacency. Everything moves slow. There’s almost no more innovation. Founder is non-existent, which is fine except there is no team lead - only a bunch of pseudo-employees incentivised to suck off protocol profits.

From D3M to RWA, Maker continues to make innovations and we currently have several financial institutions working with us. And Unlike Terra led and dictated by Do, Maker is actually a DAO and decision process is more decentralised but also more inefficient. Sad to hear that you don’t think highly of CUs but at the same time, I think that’s a motivation for all to be more committed and transparent

Do Kwon is remunerated mostly in Luna and goes on a <$50k annual wage. Folks here are asking to be paid $140k annually (in DAI) for partying all year round at crypto events. If the system can’t even handle proper capital allocation, what growth are we talking about? We won’t even attract talent.    MIP40c3-SP67: Modify Core Unit Budget - Strategic Happiness (SH-001) RFC       Appreciate everyone’s thoughts, and Jenn’s and Doo’s especially, so I’ll add my own. And I love Burban and the enthusiasm and awkwardly drawn TA lines.  But dude, you hand out t-shirts, send people socks, make memes, and travel around the world to exotic locales to get drunk and make merry. That’s not a job for normal people; it’s a fantasy. It ain’t worth two full-time salaries totaling $280,000 a year. Be reasonable and grounded in reality and come back with a number such that someone working …

autobot98765:  Do Kwon is remunerated mostly in Luna and goes on a <$50k annual wage.   Yes Do Kwon is very poor. Maybe we need to invest in more altruistic leaders who only work for the good of mankind.

Interesting considering he was paid little but had enough to bet million.    The Block    Terraform Labs CEO Do Kwon seals $10 million bet over LUNA price Terraform Labs CEO Do Kwon has finalised a bet with a crypto personality named GCR to the tune of $10 million.      Anyway, back to the main point, yes, the Maker community should be careful about its spending. But do you know in details how each dollar is spent on Terra on each detail? No, but for Maker, we do and in fact have to be approved by the Maker community for budget. That’s the strength of DAO and transparency. So while I think it’s good that we are being harsh and provide constructive criticism. Blindly thinking Terra is better is missing the point

I think it’s important not to dismiss autobot’s post because it is a perception that’s out there about mkr.  When you pay yourself highly in dai, there’s an argument to be made that you are less invested.  Core units all have mkr vesting as well but the dai salaries are already high enough that this can be perceived to be more of an added extra benefit at the expense of mkr holders rather than motivation.  If mkr simply exists for 4 years with little to no growth, members of the core units will still be doing very well.  It is good that mkr is transparent with budget and salaries but there are definitely voices out there that don’t feel heard.  One weakness I find with decentralized governance is that it does not adequately consider the voice of those who have been driven away from the protocol for whatever reason and the losing perspectives slowly lose their say.

Well interestingly he used USDT for the bet. Anyway I think he only had the money because he sold off Luna which of course mooned recently. Yes I agree with you. My point is that perhaps we should change the way we remunerate CU members. Instead of expensing DAI to CU members, we can consider structuring say 60% of their wage in MKR (to be released from the foundation) which will be locked and vested incrementally over a period of time. This forces CU members to be long term and long MKR - if MKR tanks, their wage tanks and they are stuck with us. TLDR; no more cash grab for CU members and only upside if MKR succeeds over long run. No price pumps and no lambo/ lavish lifestyle.

Yes thanks for speaking out! I just wanted to point out that the interests of MKR holders and CU unit members may be misaligned due to the compensation structure and the way decentralised governance works.
In this case, it would be a good idea to organize events such as hackathons so that the Dao can attract talent.

Yes, and we should really make sure such innovation is used for Maker’s focus. I am still bitter that we end up ironically supporting a project that became Anchor.  Screenshot_20220329-201321_Medium1080×2280 225 KB
Granted, back then the team didn’t see such a need because liquid staking or tokenizing vault was a bit beyond our planning. But yes, many missed opportunities

What ideas are on the table to make governance more efficient? in my opinion a set of incentives and motivations have to be alienated of which it is necessary to make Dao members and especially delegates aware for a less deficient governance process, basic economic incentive (Nft medals could then be given to voters depending on how positive were the consequences of their decisions in Maker), incentive of growth in knowledge and experience, motivation of self-realization, (the following is somewhat related to the previous one), motivation of having contributed or left a mark that influences as disruption in the development of the global economic market.
No matter, this world is full of opportunities, stable success is composed of multiple failures, we must try not to stumble over the same stone and bring out the market maker in us.

It’s an important question and I feel like other threads might be more fitting but in my opinion, it’s a mixture of various initiatives. For example, setting up stability fee and debt ceiling used to be a big part of governance process but that has become more efficient now by allocating such responsibility to Risk team more for example. In terms of incentives and motivations, I think this is where many have been debating. I personally think the compensation and current vesting are sufficient but then there are several who point to how other protocols provide larger benefits to their members. At the end of the day, some inefficiency is needed to allow decentralization, discussion, and participation. For example, since we are talking about Terra ecosystem, CEO Do decided to provide additional funding to subsidy the rate for Anchor and then had a short poll for deciding how much. But for Maker community, if we had a similar dApp, it would still have taken quite some time as the proposal will need to be reviewed, discussed, and likely presented to the community in calls and etc to get approval. So don’t think inefficiency is inherently a bad thing. But scaling the system to ensure ones that shouldn’t take too much inefficiency to go through the process quickly is of course needed.

Doo_StableLab:  So don’t think inefficiency is inherently a bad thing. But scaling the system to ensure ones that shouldn’t take too much inefficiency to go through the process quickly is of course needed.   Exactly in some processes I think the analogy of the tortoise and the hare could be used. Maker in governance processes is a slow and sure tortoise, which does not care much what the market (the hare) says. But sometimes the hare is an advantage for arriving first and being the first fails, for example the integration of nfts in the protocol, the entire market (hare) would have wanted that integration. But if we had done it in record time, we would currently pay the consequences of that market that is not yet mature and that its sales fell by almost 80%.

It is not just that. Terra/ Do actively collaborates with other DeFi partners.   twitter.com    Do Kwon 🌕 @stablekwon  1/ Introducing the 4pool - between@fraxfinance, TFL and@redactedcartel we pretty much own all the cvx   UST-FRAX-USDC-USDT  Curve wars are over, all emissions are going to the 4pool twitter.com/itsalwayszonny…   zon @ItsAlwaysZonny  introducing the 4pool: @terra_money 🤝 @fraxfinance  &  a kickass partnership with the flappers: @terra_money 🤝 @redactedcartel   https://t.co/CgDDvRUwGp    10:30 PM - 1 Apr 2022           2.3K                560            Now they’re getting Curve to kick DAI out of the most liquid stablecoin LP pool (3Pool). Our DAI total minted supply has been decreasing and stablecoin collateral ratio has been increasing - so we are losing market share and suffering lower profit margins by the day. Yet what are we talking about? How we can spend more marketing dollar to organise parties because the proposers are “trusted” guys. While I can understand the criticism, there are literally almost 30 other topics that are actively discussed right now from RWA to D3M to scaling up collateral onboarding and etc. And as @hexonaut noted and many agreed, Maker protocol needs growth and we are trying to push toward it: Aggressive Growth Strategy Edit: AAVE does have UST contrary to what I thought

I tend to think in terms of anti-fragility rather than inefficiency. I’m surprised so many are impressed by Terra shenanigans. Stay the course ladies and lads. We shall in due time see who blows up and who is still here allowing people around the world to trade and transact when all other systems fail.
Slander is the highest form of praise

Have I not made you happy? I have failed on my mandate then   Please… would like to personally hand you a care package at our event at ETH Amsterdam  As many in the community know by now… my budget to date… has been just a tiny supplement to my personal spending on what  I do. Yes, my current budget up there on the forum is a mess. I’ve been revising it in private. Will probably come around the May cycle.
That’s right, we will prevail, Maker will prevail against all odds

Just had to comment on Do Know’s 50k salary TFL (a private company owned by Do Kwon) controls this hot wallet that has 33B worth of Luna. For reference, Luna mcap is 39B so 84% of the supply. This is the most centralized supply of any chain in existence, with TFL having majority voting to pass any on chain proposal. We just saw Juno attempt to take funds from a wallet with governance, TFL can do that to any account at any time without needing a single additional vote. https://finder.terra.money/columbus-5/account/terra1dp0taj85ruc299rkdvzp4z5pfg6z6swaed74e6 This isn’t even behind a multisig, if this wallet is compromised, then UST goes straight to 0. The reason Do Kwon is so generously giving some of his funds to LFG to buy BTC is because TFL cashes out at the same time. There is no way for him to cash out that much Luna without building a narrative, and “donating” to LFG to buy BTC is just that.

ooof, thanks for sharing. This editorial makes excellent points and gives us a mention:  Last year, Clements published a paper about algorithmic stablecoins called “Built to Fail,” arguing that the systems are inherently fragile and can never be truly “stable.” (Note that MakerDAO’s DAI is a bit of an outlier with some unique design features, and these critiques don’t necessarily apply to it.)     coindesk.com – 22 Apr 22    ‘Built to Fail’? Why TerraUSD’s Growth Is Giving Finance Experts Nightmares The Terra/Luna blockchain is growing at a blinding pace. At its heart, according to some critics, is a ticking time bomb.
sadly we need another Crypto Winter to wash away reckless business models…

its not a serious bear market if it allows nonsense like this to thrive

Wow, crazy day. One thing, frens, is that I caution against anything approaching gloating or engaging negatively with the LUNAtics and Do Kwon about this. A lot of people are getting completely torched with UST/Luna, and there will be hell to pay for Terraform Labs, the LFG and Do Kwon personally. No need to rub salt in the wound of those who suffered as a result of the three aforementioned parties. They likely will be tied up in God knows what for the next five years… #winwithgrace

Tosh it’s true about not throwing salt in the wound, but they deserve a bit of their own medicine, for the common user this is obviously not good. Hopefully they will recover the peg soon, I’ve already seen news that they are selling their BTC reserves, we’ll see how the market reacts.

Don’t worry about that – these clowns are going to learn the meaning of “getting pegged” very shortly. Hope UST never recovers and they explode. Time for the invisible hand to take out the UST trash (along with all their pumpers that separated fools from their money).
It is not yet known if they really sold the backup Bitcoins, that De-peg will most likely recover, but already many lost confidence in ust.

In some sense, this market shakeout is actually very beneficial to MKR’s position in the market.  We’re now seeing a slight rebound in MKR’s value and I think through UST’s downfall, people are recognizing the strength of MKR’s conservative and sound balance sheet management.

Time for the invisible hand to take out the UST trash (along with all their pumpers that separated fools from their money).   LOOOL!

It’s not a new story even anymore. New team comes in with next-gen stablecoin solution, people ape in proclaiming the death of DAI, next-gen stablecoin solution collapses under a bank run, rinse, repeat. Even if the UST peg recovers, do you want a stablecoin that behaves this way under stress? Fair play to those looking to make a quick buck on these projects but there’s a reason why Maker moves slowly and methodically.
hehehehe,  it was my split personality!
Your last comment made my day hahaha
This is a GREAT chart! Let’s go!
DAI’s strength can be seen there awesome

Like many others on this forum, I genuinely believed that Terra/Luna were teetering on the edge of catastrophe with an unsound model - but it’s still a shock to watch such a large project collapse in real time. The UST peg is still a mess (currently at 70c) and Luna continues to drop off a sheer cliff. At this rate, Maker will have the higher market cap by the end of the week…  image896×520 39.2 KB  vs  image890×548 42.3 KB  Great for Maker, although dangerous for crypto overall - this is a perfect example of what makes people so nervous about the space. Yellen won’t be the last regulator to latch onto the Terra trainwreck as a cudgel against the broader industry… (cc this @PaperImperium tweet).
-99.4% is crazy for a project that went so far, 40,2 billion went up in smoke in a matter of weeks, wise to learn from your mistakes but even wiser to learn from the mistakes of others.
Peak hubris.  twitter.com    Do Kwon 🌕 @stablekwon  By my hand $DAI will die.   4:54 AM - 23 Mar 2022           5.3K                540
Matt_NZ:  At this rate, Maker will have the higher market cap by the end of the week   Wow - I should have said by the end of the day…  image886×490 38.2 KB  vs  image904×514 43.3 KB
At the same time, we should also make sure we don’t fall into same pride trap
image1730×292 44 KB  the original flippening has just occurred.

Well over 400 million Luna was just issued and continues to be issued and their supply is now 246 million over the 1 billion they started with.  Beyond the solid collateral we are backed by and the SB, MKR’s model is not so different.  So It does go to show how important the peg is.  If you lose ability to maintain the peg, you have a very small window of time to get it back before investor confidence is lost.  And once you lose confidence, you’ll die very quickly because who wants to be holding a coin that’s being rapidly diluted if you can’t see an end in sight? If markets stabilize and we’re able to stop the USDC PSM bleeding , I could see a lot of that UST demand coming this way.  I think that’s what the market is seeing too.  But we’re also facing a loss of demand for stablecoins in general I think because of the higher fed rates so we will have to solve that soon.

Traster_Tray:  But we’re also facing a loss of demand for stablecoins   This is the key point. Also, if MakerDAO does not execute its business strategy it can have its cake eaten by competitors like: Introducing DigitalDollar ($DUSD) | by Fluid Finance | Fluid Finance | Medium

Indeed. The MakerDAO community also needs to move faster. Reaching a consensus and ratifying proposals are the core values of MakerDAO. At the same time, it slows us down. Let’s be more open-minded when it comes to various proposals. Without giving those teams a try, it is hard to see whether they can deliver or not.

Traster_Tray:  But we’re also facing a loss of demand for stablecoins in general I think because of the higher fed rates so we will have to solve that soon.   Yup. And some of the “stablecoins” getting wrecked this week is not helping the general perception of stablecoins. But this is really a huge opportunity to capitalize on the Luna fiasco and explain why we are better!

Traster_Tray:  If markets stabilize and we’re able to stop the USDC PSM bleeding , I could see a lot of that UST demand coming this way   DAI demand is low now but if the broader crypto markets keep this up, people are going to need DAI to close their vaults creating a supply reduction too. Of the two, the latter tends to be more sudden but this is the reason why we have a PSM.
What the fed is doing should encourage institutions to borrow from Maker, as it would save them some interest.
Ust left a market gap, more opportunity for Dai
But they can borrow the DAI and then immediately convert to usd if they want.  We need people who are willing to hold DAI as well.

I am very concerned about the regulations that this may lead to in the future, I mean UST was too big to fall like this, there will be more pressure on stablecoins and probably from governments to implement their “solutions” such as the digital dollar.

I see with more logic that the fall of Luna and Ust was not only because they made an unsustainable economic system in the long term, but another factor like the Sitadel and BlackRock attack with supposed shorts against Btc, Luna and Ust, are rumors but it makes more sense that this is caused by the two factors together, because -99% is not absolutely normal. I don’t think this will be a problem for the stable coin regulations as they themselves have the obligation to do their own DYOR before regulating and accepting something, so they will qualify which projects are sustainable and which are unsustainable.

The Government is watching stablecoins for sure and it’s for that reason, amongst others it seems.  See the remarks from the SEC Chair here;    sec.gov   SEC.gov | Prepared Remarks of Gary Gensler On Crypto Markets Penn Law Capital... Prepared Remarks of Gary Gensler On Crypto Markets Penn Law Capital Markets Association Annual Conference by Chair Gary Gensler April 4, 2022      There have been other press releases like this I think.

The inefficiency in the economic model that Luna and UST had will help create a perfect excuse for the regulations on cryptocurrencies and stable coins to be imminent and to be applied in a much closer period than we had thought.    euronews – 13 May 22    Global crypto regulation body likely in next year, top official says The wild volatility of cryptocurrency markets this week has alarmed financial watchdogs, and clearer rules may be coming soon.         coindesk.com – 12 May 22    Global Crypto Regulatory Body Is Coming Soon, Says Top Official A joint body to coordinate efforts at regulating crypto at the global level could become a reality in the next year, according to IOSCO chair Ashley Alder. Est. reading time: 2 minutes       I really don’t know what the near future holds and if regulations are good or bad for the ecosystem

Interesting overview of what’s happening in Terra community. There’s a debate on focusing on saving UST or LUNA. Ironically, as the voting power comes from Luna, the community might end up favoring Luna over UST. [Proposal] Forget UST, save LUNA - Governance & Proposals - Terra Research Forum

The last thing said by Kwon is that he is looking for a fork of the chain just before the UST odds at 0.93 with the dollar (with the approval of the community) this would leave a new community of Holders who tried to save Luna or speculate but then observe that there are burnings of Luna encouraging that there will not be a fork, the future of Luna is really very confusing, if it manages to save the chain it is a miracle

Doo_StableLab:  There’s a debate on focusing on saving UST or LUNA. Ironically, as the voting power comes from Luna, the community might end up favoring Luna over UST.   They could, but fat chance getting any user to trust a stablecoin they make after this. The reason DAI continued to be trusted even after Black Thursday is because MKR holders took the hit and never let DAI holders take a haircut!
Its a stablecoin.     Or not
Yes, but looking at it, they might just ditch stablecoin path and go in L1 business instead

They may also want Luna back more than Ust for the following reason, if they save Ust many will get their money back but if they save Luna, not only many will get their money back but those who bought Luna at $0.0000009 have a very clear incentive, I think it is easier for them to start again from scratch, with a bearmarket proof system and massive shorts, not making the same mistakes as in the past, than to continue with terra.

I like what Vitalik is saying as to reimbursing the small holders.    Cointelegraph    Buterin: Terra should protect the smallholders, not the whales Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin thinks there should be some sort of financial deposit insurance for the smaller LUNA and UST investors.

It is already observed, they want to fork Luna and make LunaC CZ was against that, the creator of Doge Shibetoshi too Practically what Kwon wants is to make a Vitalik Buterin 2.0, the difference is that Ethereum did present a true ecosystem outside of finance.
“Bifurcating and coining does not add value”, but in a way dilutes it

what easy comes easy goes It sounds like a joke, but work2earn is more reliable than all the hype and FOMO together. And, of course, humility is always essential. People say, “the fish dies by the mouth.”

Imo we should be prouder, we lack this in our community. Not proud of price dynamics, but proud of the project, and what people who work and contribute and had worked before us have accomplished. There are no other projects on our level of sophistication in many aspects.

I agree with @rema. Doo is right that hubris is a treacherous tendency (particularly in a stablecoin protocol), but Maker is hardly on the path of unquestioning hero-worship that characterised Terra. A different risk, particularly going into a bear market or broad recession, is that Maker’s community loses faith in the protocol’s achievements and ongoing progress. As @GFXlabs put it in their good piece today on DeFi: “MakerDAO started with a simple idea: make a stable currency backed by a volatile asset. Single collateral Dai was an amazing achievement and — after extensive development — became the first tangible example of decentralized finance’s potential. Since its inception, MakerDAO has evolved more than any other project and has consistently led DeFi in almost every respect: token locked value, collateral assets, assets borrowed, governance processes, organizational structure, and engineering development.” There’s a lot to be proud of.

Many Defi protocols suffered a very strong blow in their liquidity pools, among them osmosis of cosmos, now they are considering which stable coin to implement after this catastrophe, it is very clear that it is Dai, if they do not want to go through the same thing again. The Interblockchain Communication Protocol also received a heavy blow.

South Korean financial regulators have commenced terra probes. I suspect there will be more to come. We also know the history that preceded this recent debacle.    cryptonews.com    South Korean Financial Regulators Begin Terra Probes, Politician Calls for... The Terraform Labs mastermind Do Kwon (real name Kwon Do-hyeong) could be facing trouble from financial and law enforcement authorities in South Korea and Singapore as a torrid month for the terra (LUNA) platform just keeps getting worse.

Yes, but I doubt they will be held accountable in Korea. I think exchanges might be called to respond to some questions but they won’t be able to get Do or Terra team itself. Terra’s Korean company was dissolved days ago

To clarify, I didn’t say we should not be proud of ourselves. Just that we shouldn’t fall into the same hubris. Also, when Maker accounted for 80-90% of DeFi’s TVL, we had such hubris as well. I remember privately many were confident that Maker will be always #1 in TVL and account for majority because we are the most innovative protocol. However, it also made the team reluctant to try experiments that are “obvious” now such as having WBTC and USDC as collateral. Or having LP or other forms of tokens as collateral. Or expanding to different mainnets. Various crisis humbled Maker and also made the system more resilient.
Indeed PRIDE goeth before the FALL

MFeinberg:  South Korean financial regulators have commenced terra probes. I suspect there will be more to come.   Yep. It’s never a great sign when your entire legal team resigns:    The Block    Terraform Labs’ legal team resigns after UST collapse The in-house legal team at Terraform Labs resigned shortly after the collapse of Terra’s algorithmic stablecoin.
I saw that too. There could be more to the story than we know.

In moments of crisis is where the value is seen, where what has been built is put to the test. We should be proud that Maker, in spite of everything, continues on a good path, with failures and successes. What is certain is that in these moments we must build as a community to be the most assertive to achieve the future of innovative Maker.

And finally, it has arrived:    Watcher Guru – 26 Sep 22    Interpol Issues Worldwide Arrest Warrant For Terra founder Do Kwon The International Criminal Police Organization [Interpol] has issued a Red Notice against the Terra founder. Confirming the same..  Est. reading time: 2 minutes

Positive things to extract from this news.   Any famous enough scam in the cryptocurrency world will eventually have a happy ending   Increased concern when a group of people try to create a scam project   Traditional investors will be able to lose their fear of cryptocurrencies   Greater investment capital in “unregulated” decentralized media   Negative things to extract from this news.   Centralization will eventually dominate the market if we don’t take action.   Hackers will be more detailed when applying a crypto scam.   The rules will be applied much faster.   The future of cryptocurrencies as it has always been exposed will be implemented in the real world, decentralized media could even disappear or remain eternally anonymous as a kind of black market (where the largest amount of capital in the world is)
